error.regex: TLS handshake timeout|tls: handshake failure|tls handshake.*timeout

verdict.summary: The TLS handshake did not complete within the configured timeout. Causes include slow DNS, network congestion, misconfigured TLS, or connecting to a non-TLS port with a TLS client.

dead_ends.why_fails: InsecureSkipVerify skips certificate validation but does not fix handshake timeouts — the timeout occurs before certificate verification

dead_ends.action: Downgrade to HTTP instead of HTTPS
dead_ends.why_fails: Removes transport security entirely — only masks the problem

workarounds.action: Increase TLSHandshakeTimeout on the HTTP transport
Verify the target server supports the TLS version your client offers
workarounds.how: Set tls.Config MinVersion and MaxVersion to match server capabilities. Use openssl s_client -connect host:port to diagnose.
workarounds.condition: when server uses TLS 1.3 only and client defaults to TLS 1.2

leads_to.condition: when TLS handshake timeout causes the overall request context to expire

preceded_by.condition: when TCP connection succeeds but TLS negotiation stalls

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'TLS handshake timeout' occurs after TCP connection is established during TLS negotiation, while 'dial timeout' occurs during the initial TCP connection.
